On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 1:03 PM, Sebastien Lambla <seb@...> wrote:
>
>
> As for the multiple ways in which data can change, could you provide an
> example you think is not achievable so we can have a baseline for
> discussion? I refuse the hypothesis that there is no way to map a rich
> domain with CQS and granular document-based resources. I argue that it's a
> complex problem I'd like to discuss more.
>

Suppose someone does a PUT on /Customer/XYZ/Address and the server
receives an updated address.  Assuming the domain model accepts two
potential messages for updating an address:
 - CorrectCustomerAddress
 - CustomerHasMovedToNewAddress

Which one command message do you send based on the updated address
received in the PUT?

Darrel
